Sentencas: This work focuses on the deposition of thin-film electrolytes.
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Sol-Gel Spin-coating technique has been used to create thin films and subsequent characterization of the different sub-surfaces has been undertaken.
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The substrates are composed of ferritic oxide strengthened Fe-Cr alloy (ITM).
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells

Sentencas: A common challenge in coating these supports is their high roughness and porosity in comparison with state-of-the-art ceramic substrates.
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Here, the nickel and 8mol.% yttria-stabilized zirconia (8YSZ) based anode is made of graded layers, which reduces the roughness and porosity of the metal support.
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The quality of the thin spin-coated electrolyte-layers depends on the microstructure of the sub-surface.
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Influencial variables are the surface roughness, the pore size and its depth.
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells

Sentencas: To understand the dependencies between these variables and the coating properties, analyses with various optical measurement methods have been carried out prior to coating.
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Standard roughness detection using optical profilometry and confocal laser scanning microscopy were compared for surface characterization.
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The Sobel edge detection method was used to analyze images and was able to clearly reveal defects.
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The fabricated electrolytes have a thickness approximate to 0.5m with leak rates of 1-10x10(-4) (hPadm(3)s(-1)cm(-2)) against air of metallic supported cells with a reduced anode, which are comparable to those of anode-supported cells.
Titulo: Thin Electrolytes on Metal-Supported Fuel Cells
